sense.name: error check
sense.commentary: EXAMINATION[+event] scrutiny - the act of examining something closely
sense.examples: Her examination was at 9am but the doctor had to reschedule. George makes sure to do a daily examination of Fido's paws to check for blisters. The Jesuits do a daily examination of conscience.

sense.name: written test
sense.commentary: exam - a set of questions or exercises evaluating skill or knowledge
sense.examples: When the test was stolen the professor had to make a new set of questions. George can remember every question on the test.

sense.name: oral test
sense.commentary: EXAMINATION[+event] interrogation, interrogatory - formal systematic questioning
sense.examples: The third degree is a severe examination. The examination took place during the interview and lasted only ten minutes.

sense.name: testing
sense.commentary: EXAMINATION[+event] the act of giving students or candidates a test (as by questions) to determine what they know or have learned
sense.examples: The company's annual examination will be on Tuesday at 9:00am. Placement examination will be on August 15th.
